solution_line_template: If it takes Hugo twice the amount of time to fold a medium box than a small box, then he needs {medium_box_time_multiplier}*{hugo_small_box_time} = <<{hugo_medium_box_time}={hugo_medium_box_time}>>{hugo_medium_box_time} seconds for the medium box

If there are {num_small_boxes} small boxes and Hugo can fold 1 box in {hugo_small_box_time} seconds, then it would take him {num_small_boxes}*{hugo_small_box_time} = <<{num_small_boxes}*{hugo_small_box_time}={time_hugo_small_boxes}>>{time_hugo_small_boxes} seconds to fold all boxes

If there are {num_medium_boxes} medium boxes and Tom can fold 1 box in {tom_box_time} seconds, then it would take him {num_medium_boxes}*{tom_box_time} = <<{num_medium_boxes}*{tom_box_time}={time_tom_medium_boxes}>>{time_tom_medium_boxes} seconds to fold all medium boxes
Given that they need the same amount of time to fold all boxes, and are doing it simultaneously they will need {time_hugo_small_boxes} seconds to fold all the boxes
